channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Probing weak chemical interactions of metal surface atoms with CO-terminated AFM tips identifies molecular adsorption sites
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 23 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63159-x

Understanding molecule-surface interactions is key to neat on-surface synthesis of functional nanomaterials. Here, the authors measure interactions of metal surface atoms with CO-terminated tips to reveal their nature and reliable adsorption sites.
item.dc:title: Probing weak chemical interactions of metal surface atoms with CO-terminated AFM tips identifies molecular adsorption sites
item.dc:creator: Jalmar Tschakert
Qigang Zhong
Alexander Sekels
Pascal Henkel
Jannis Jung
K. Linus H. Pohl
Hermann A. Wegner
Doreen Mollenhauer
André Schirmeisen
Daniel Ebeling

item.title: Wide temperature range adaptable electric field driven binder for advanced lithium-sulfur batteries
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 23 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62909-1

Complex environments with varying temperatures remain a major challenge for batteries. Here, authors develop a polymer composite binder with dynamic active sites and phase change properties, enabling lithium sulfur batteries to operate stably over a wide temperature range of −40 °C to 60 °C.
item.dc:title: Wide temperature range adaptable electric field driven binder for advanced lithium-sulfur batteries
item.dc:creator: Wanyuan Jiang
Xin Jin
Borui Li
Yunpeng Qu
Lin Wang
Ce Song
Mengfan Pei
Tianpeng Zhang
Xigao Jian
Fangyuan Hu

item.title: Bilateral Geiger mode avalanche in InSe Schottky photodiodes
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 23 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62383-9

Zhao et al. report bilateral Geiger mode avalanche in 2D graphene/InSe/Cr asymmetrical Schottky junction. The asymmetrical Schottky junction benefits to initiate impact ionization and multiplication for the injected majority carriers, leading to a multiplication factor up to 10 ^ 7 and a breakdown voltage of 1.4 V.
item.dc:title: Bilateral Geiger mode avalanche in InSe Schottky photodiodes
item.dc:creator: Dongyang Zhao

Hechun Cao

item.title: Atomically precise gold nanocluster boosting selective hydrogenation of nitroarene by H<sub>2</sub> in water
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 23 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63124-8

The chemoselective hydrogenation of molecules containing multiple reducible groups using molecular hydrogen presents inherent challenges. Here, the authors synthesize a homoleptic gold nanocluster that demonstrates exceptional catalytic selectivity, activity, and yield for the hydrogenation of 4-nitroacetophenone in water under mild conditions.
item.dc:title: Atomically precise gold nanocluster boosting selective hydrogenation of nitroarene by H<sub>2</sub> in water
item.dc:creator: Xiao-Xiao Lai
Jianyu Wei
Ting-Ting Liu
Jing Li
Jiao-Jiao Li
Xian-Kai Wan
Quan-Ming Wang
